column4: how do i install cdrw softwere thats not for data only thats all i could find for ubuntu
look up k3b?
check synaptic for that
do you have the universe repository enabled?
just came back
here http://www.ubuntulinux.org/support/documentation/howto/helpcenterhowto.2004-09-30.5359349801
its probably because you arent root
can you open up a terminal
cd /etc/apt/
ect is not the same as etc
type 'pwd' what does it tell you?
sudo vim sources.list'
sudo vim sources.list
move the cursor down to the '#' marks in front of the universe lines
and when you want to delete whatever is under the cursor, just hit 'x'
and then to quit and save the file type ':wq!'
just type ':q!' and then redo that sudo vim sources.list command
you can also copy and past by highlighting and then middle clicking where you want to paste
gksudo not qksudo
middle click is left and right mouse buttons at the same time
type either k3b or k3bsetup in a terminal
or type 'sudo k3b' or 'sudo k3bsetup'
it starts from terminal?
thats good, i'd ask around to find out how to add menu entries for gnome
